column3: The NULLIF() function returns null if two specified expressions are equal.
column4: The COALESCE() function returns the first non-null value from a list of values.
column5: The IF() function evaluates a condition and returns a value based on the evaluation.
column7: The CASE statement allows you to perform conditional logic within a query.

column3: SELECT NULLIF(expression1, expression2) AS alias FROM table_name;
column4: SELECT COALESCE(value1, value2, .) AS alias FROM table_name;
column5: SELECT IF(condition, true_value, false_value) AS alias FROM table_name;
column6: ELSE default_result END AS alias FROM table_name;
column7: SELECT column1, column2, CASE WHEN condition1 THEN result1 WHEN condition2 THEN result2

column3: SELECT NULLIF(total_amount, discounted_amount) AS diff_amount FROM orders;
column4: SELECT COALESCE(first_name, middle_name) AS preferred_name FROM employees;
column5: SELECT name, age, IF(age > 50, 'Senior', 'Junior') AS employee_category FROM employees;
column6: > 500 THEN 'Medium Value Order' ELSE 'Low Value Order' END AS order_status
column7: SELECT order_id, total_amount, CASE WHEN total_amount > 1000 THEN 'High Value Order' WHEN total_amount
